title: Toni Duggan's Atletico Madrid scramble late Champions League draw at Manchester City
text:
Manchester City 1 Atlético Madrid 1

Ahead of returning to her old club Manchester City for the first time Toni Duggan had said she didn’t want to go back to the next England camp with everyone else talking about Champions League games and her having been knocked of the action by her international teammates. On Wednesday the Atlético Madrid forward will be able to put that worry aside for the time being as her team played out a draw in the first leg of their Champions League last 16 tie.

Duggan, who left City in 2017 to play for Barcelona for two years before moving to Altético for the start of this season, had at least 20 tickets for her friends and family to watch her team pick up a potentially important away goal.

City, who would have been looking to banish the memories of last year, when Atlético knocked them out in the last 32, cannot yet breathe easy. Atlético looked promising despite having had to deal with a change of manager just seven days ago as José Luis Sánchez Vera resigned for personal reasons, to be replaced by Pablo Lopez Salgado until the end of the season.

It was a dangerous start for Manchester City as they almost gave a penalty away, but instead Gemma Bonner came away with a yellow card for her challenge on Ludmila Da Silva as the contact started just outside the box.
